revised_title: Robert Hooke's Contributions to Scientific Instruments and Natural Philosophy
tldr: This article explores the work of Robert Hooke, focusing on his contributions to scientific instruments and natural philosophy. Hooke, who served as Curator of Experiments to the Royal Society, worked on a wide range of subjects and inventions, including the air pump, microscope, and various scales and measuring devices. His role as a link between natural philosophers and instrument makers highlights the importance of his work in the development of scientific instruments during the second half of the 17th century.
